The worst part - these misleading attempts to poison the well only hurt the most vulnerable among us and thousands of students seeking a higher education. Let's stop with the bickering and move forward with solutions.

Senate Dems have now twice blocked efforts to pass legislation to permanently reauthorize HBCU funding, expand and increase the maximum Pell grant, and take multiple other steps to support our HBCUs. Once again, my friends on the left are not telling the whole story here.

A short thread on recent claims by some Democrats regarding HBCU funding: I’m a proud sponsor of the bipartisan FUTURE Act to extend funding for HBCUs, and have been joined on the bill by multiple other Senate Republicans.

Listen to @WVOCColumbia today as I discuss the Congressional Democrats' misguided attempt to destroy opportunity and hurt low-income communities.

The past 50 years of fighting poverty through government-led programs has been largely ineffective, so let’s make sure the next 50 are powered by efforts that will work. I’ll save you the tweets, but do take a moment and read my full thoughts here: https://www.scott.senate.gov/media-center/press-releases/scott-responds-to-democrat-efforts-to-destroy-opportunity …

Instead of trying to take down Opportunity Zones because of their distaste for @realDonaldTrump and our successful #taxreform package, I invite Democrats to come to the table and work together on a path forward.

I stand ready to improve the #OpportunityZones initiative in a positive way with anyone who wants to work together. None of this backroom dealing is helpful for people, who like me, grew up in single-parent households mired in poverty.

This is absolutely egregious, as we should be looking for ways to help improve the health of folks living in #OpportunityZones, where the average life expectancy is 3 years shorter than the natl average and the avg obesity rate is significantly higher than the national average.

In fact, @WhipClyburn & @RonWyden's will classify 'health centers' as a sin business and exclude them from the initiative. So there's a good chance our community centers and YMCAs are gone. Our after-school programs? Yup, they're gone too. All of our children's safe havens; gone.

Let me be even more clear. This is a state-driven initiative. 96% of zones show NO sign of gentrification. The other 4%? Go ask their governors—most of which are led by Democrats, like @RonWyden's. @WhipClyburn and Wyden seem to ignore this fact. Why? Well, it's pretty obvious.

.@WhipClyburn & @RonWyden's bill would END:
✔️ Multiple OZ with a child poverty rate >30%
✔️ Multiple OZ with poverty rates >25% (double their statewide avg)
✔️ At least 1 zone with a senior poverty rate >40%
✔️ An OZ where African-Americans are 20% of the community

Some facts about #OpportunityZones for y'all: 
✔️ An estimated $63 billion can already be expected to be invested into them 
✔️ There are 8,700 Zones with the average poverty rate of 29% 

It's easy to lay out numbers, but these are people's LIVES that we're talking about.

This is the second misguided attempt by Congressional Democrats in the last two weeks to wreck the #OpportunityZone initiative under the guise of ‘improvement.’ Word on the street is that The Squad is coming after the program too in the next few days/weeks...

It looks like my colleagues @WhipClyburn and @RonWyden are in backdoor negotiations to systematically destroy my #OpportunityZones initiative. Y'all know me and I'm going to be completely frank here — they're only doing this because it has the support of @realDonaldTrump.

Back home in South Carolina, #OpportunityZones are offering hope to the communities that need it most. I look forward to seeing my state take charge in figuring out ways to maximize the impact of this initiative. https://www.postandcourier.com/opinion/editorials/editorial-south-carolina-should-lead-on-opportunity-zone-development/article_36957e78-016e-11ea-a873-5f95d1fd0066.html …
